title-part.text: MODIFYING THE PHYSICAL STRUCTURE OF FERROUS METALS
GENERAL DEVICES FOR HEAT TREATMENT OF FERROUS OR NON-FERROUS METALS OR ALLOYS
MAKING METAL MALLEABLE, e.g. BY DECARBURISATION OR TEMPERING

reference.text: surface treatment of metallic material involving at least one process provided for in class C23 and at least one process covered by this subclass C23F17/00; unidirectional solidification of eutectic materials or unidirectional demixing of eutectoid materials C30B

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: General methods or devices for heat treatment, e.g. annealing, hardening, quenching or tempering
Hardening articles or materials formed by forging or rolling, with no further heating beyond that required for the formation
with simultaneous application of supersonic waves, magnetic or electric fields
by direct application of electrical or wave energy
Quenching with or without subsequent tempering
Hardening, combined with annealing between 300 degrees Celsius and 600 degrees Celsius, i.e. heat refining ("Vergüten")
Determining when the hardening temperature has been reached by measurement of magnetic or electrical properties
Liquefied or solidified normally gaseous material
Temporary coatings or embedding materials applied before or during heat treatment
Methods of treatment in inert gas, controlled atmosphere, vacuum or pulverulent material
Adjusting the composition of the atmosphere
Combined heat-treatments not provided for above

reference.text: mechanically B21, B23; chemically C23; electrolytically C25F1/00

title-part.text: Diffusion processes for extraction of non-metals
improving the malleability of grey cast-iron
Hardening by cooling below 0 degrees Celsius
Modifying the physical properties of iron or steel by deformation

reference.text: apparatus for mechanical working of metal B21, B23, B24

title-part.text: of the whole cross-section, e.g. of concrete reinforcing bars
Modifying the physical properties by deformation combined with, or followed by, heat treatment

reference.text: hardening articles or materials formed by forging or rolling with no further heating beyond that required for the formation C21D1/02

title-part.text: during manufacturing of plates or strips

note.note-paragraph: In this group classification is made according to the most important feature in one subgroup only; for other features indexing codes of C21D are added

with diffusion of elements, e.g. decarburising, nitriding

the working step(s) being of interest

title-part.text: Heat treatment, e.g. annealing, hardening, quenching or tempering, adapted for particular articles

CPC-specific-text.text: Details, accessories not peculiar to any of the following furnaces
for charging, discharging or manipulation of charge
Rotary furnaces with horizontal or slightly inclined axis
Rotary furnaces with vertical axis; Furnaces with rotating floor
Furnaces in which the charge is moving up or down
Furnaces through which the charge is moved in a horizontal straight path
Heat-treating apparatus with a cooling or quenching zone
for particular articles not mentioned below

title-part.text: with diminished tendency to become wavy
for knives, scythes, scissors, or like hand cutting tools
for gear wheels, worm wheels, or the like
for equipment for lining mine shafts, e.g. segments, rings or props
Furnaces for treating strips or wire
Continuous furnaces for strip or wire

adapted for treating the charge in vacuum or special atmosphere

Furnaces for ingots, i.e. soaking pits
